cold.answer:
🤒 Common Cold Care

✅ What to do:
• Stay hydrated with warm fluids (tea, broth)
• Use saline nasal spray for congestion relief
• Rest and get plenty of sleep to help recovery

🚨 See a doctor if:
• Fever stays above 100.4°F (38°C) for more than 3 days
• Trouble breathing, wheezing, or chest tightness
• Symptoms worsen after a week instead of improving

flu.answer:
🤧 Flu (Influenza) Care

✅ What to do:
• Rest and drink lots of fluids
• Take acetaminophen (Tylenol) or ibuprofen for fever
• If severe, antiviral medication (Tamiflu) may help

🚨 Go to the ER if:
• You have difficulty breathing or chest pain
• Your lips or face turn bluish
• Severe dizziness or confusion occurs

burn.answer:
🔥 Burn First Aid

✅ How to treat:
1. Cool with room-temperature water for 20 minutes (do not use ice)
2. Apply antibiotic ointment (like silver sulfadiazine)
3. Cover with a clean, non-stick bandage

🚨 See a doctor if:
• Burn is larger than your palm
• Skin turns white, leathery, or has no feeling
• It covers the face, hands, or genitals

cut.answer:
🩹 Wound Care

✅ Steps to follow:
1. Clean the wound with sterile saline or clean water
2. Apply direct pressure for 10 minutes if bleeding
3. Cover with a sterile bandage and apply antibiotic ointment

🚨 Stitches needed if:
• Cut is deeper than 0.5 cm (¼ inch) or longer than 2 cm (¾ inch)
• Edges won’t stay together or bleeding won’t stop
• It's on a joint and keeps reopening

sprain.answer:
🦵 Sprain Treatment (R.I.C.E. Method)

✅ What to do:
• 🛑 Rest – Avoid using the injured limb for 48 hours
• ❄️ Ice – Apply a cold pack for 20 minutes every 2 hours
• 🩹 Compression – Wrap with an elastic bandage to reduce swelling
• 🛏️ Elevation – Keep your limb raised above heart level

🚨 Seek medical attention if:
• You can’t put weight on the joint at all
• There is numbness, tingling, or severe swelling

rash.answer:
🔴 Skin Rash Care

✅ How to treat:
• Apply 1% hydrocortisone cream twice daily
• Use fragrance-free moisturizers to prevent irritation
• Cool compresses help relieve itching

🚨 See a doctor if:
• The rash is spreading quickly or comes with fever
• There are blisters, pus, or severe pain

diarrhea.answer:
💦 Diarrhea Management

✅ What to do:
• Drink an oral rehydration solution (1L water + 6 tsp sugar + 1 tsp salt)
• Eat the BRAT diet: Bananas, Rice, Applesauce, Toast
• Take probiotics or zinc supplements (20 mg/day)

🚨 Seek medical care if:
• You see blood in your stool
• You have severe dehydration (sunken eyes, dry mouth, no urination)
• Diarrhea lasts more than 3 days

allergy.answer:
🤧 Allergy Relief

✅ How to manage:
• Take antihistamines like loratadine (Claritin) or cetirizine (Zyrtec)
• Use a saline nasal rinse for congestion
• Avoid allergens (dust, pollen, pet dander)

🚨 Emergency signs (call 911):
• Swelling of the throat or trouble breathing
• Hives all over the body with dizziness
• Severe stomach cramps or vomiting
sources: AAAAI (American Academy of Allergy, Asthma, and Immunology)

stomach pain.answer:
🤢 Stomach Pain Causes & Treatment

✅ Common causes & what to do:
• Gas or indigestion → Sip warm ginger tea, avoid spicy foods
• Food poisoning → Drink water, avoid solid foods for a few hours
• Acid reflux → Take antacids (Tums, Pepto-Bismol), avoid caffeine

🚨 Seek urgent care if:
• Severe pain in lower right side (appendicitis risk)
• Vomiting blood or black stool
• Pain lasts more than 24 hours or worsens
